required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerance of a Partly Fermented Infant Formula With Prebiotic Oligosaccharides in Healthy Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Controlled, Double-blind, Parallel Group, Multi-country Study to Investigate the Safety and Tolerance of a Partly Fermented Infant Formula Containing Prebiotic Oligosaccharides in Healthy Term Infants

brief_summary.textblock: A randomised, controlled, double-blind, parallel group, multi-country study to investigate the safety and tolerance of a partly fermented infant formula containing prebiotic oligosaccharides in healthy term infants.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Equivalence of weight gain per day (g/d) from baseline until 17 weeks of age in subjects receiving the test product compared to infants receiving the control product

secondary_outcome.description: Equivalence of weight gain per day (g/d) from baseline until 17 weeks of age in subjects receiving the test product compared to infants receiving human milk
Equivalence of length gain per day (mm/d) from baseline until 17 weeks of age in subjects receiving the test product compared to infants receiving the control product or human milk
Equivalence of head circumference gain per day (mm/d) from baseline until 17 weeks of age in subjects receiving the test product compared to infants receiving the control product or human milk
Information on regurgitation and vomiting will be collected by a daily diary that is completed by the parents.

secondary_outcome.measure: Parent-Reported Stool Characteristics (adapted Amsterdam Stool Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: Information on stool consistency (4-point scale) and stool frequency (number of stools per day) will be collected by a daily diary that is completed by the parents. Occurrence of diarrhea like-symptoms and constipation-like symptoms will be derived from the stool frequency and consistency data.
Number of adverse events (by "System/Organ Class" and "Preferred term" according the MedDRA) as assessed and reported by the investigator.
Severity of adverse events (by "System/Organ Class" and "Preferred term" according the MedDRA) as assessed and reported by the investigator.

arm_group.description: Cows milk based infant formula containing fermented infant formula and prebiotic oligosaccharides
Cows milk based infant formula containing prebiotic oligosaccharides (commercially available Aptamil ProNutra)
Exclusively breastfed from birth to study completion

intervention.description: Infants are randomized to one of two infant formulas from <14 days of age to 17 weeks of age.

overall_contact.last_name: Jan van der Mooren, MD, PhD
